title: Costa's offering free coffee for an entire day – here's how to get yours
text:
Costa: You can get a free coffee on Tuesday 1 October. [Photo: Getty]

Costa is offering its customers a free coffee for the whole day next Tuesday 1 October, which marks International Coffee Day.

Rather than giving free coffee away at its physical stores, the UK-based coffee franchise will be allowing its customers to get their cup at its over 8,500 Costa Express machines nationwide.

A range of complimentary drinks will be available, including latte, americano, cappuccino, espresso and, for those who don’t like coffee, hot chocolate. Newer machines also include flat white, cortado and flavoured milk drinks options.

READ MORE: Coffee company to pay someone £24k to quit their job and travel the world

All you have to do is scan your Costa Coffee app, which can be downloaded here if you don’t have it.

The brand hopes the machine will reverse a time-old “stigma” surrounding self-serve coffee machines, Costa Express managing director Scott Martin said in a press release.

Costa: Claim your free coffee from a Costa Express machine. [Photo: Getty] More

This stigma, he claims, is down to the “freeze-dried coffee, long life milk, clumpy soups and bland hot chocolate were readily stocked in machines across the late nineties and early noughties.”

However, Martin insists Costa Express’ machines are a mile away from this, serving the “fresh signature Mocha Italia coffee beans and fresh semi-skimmed milk you would expect in our Costa Coffee stores.”

READ MORE: Drinking coffee could help you lose weight

So, if you’re still a cynic when it comes buying your coffee from a self-serve machine, you can challenge your preconceptions for free come Tuesday.
